textos_fuente.text: Welcome To The Fox & Hounds : Fox and Hound Home Food & Wine Events Gallery Contact Something for Everyone A Place for Good Taste Pop in to the bar Passionate about food The Fox and Hounds is a country pub and restaurant in the village of Englefield Green. Located near the gates of Windsor Great Park, it is a perfect venue after a day’s walk in the Berkshire countryside. We have a large, terraced garden to enjoy in the summer with a bottle of Provençal rosé while in winter we light the fires and serve comforting casseroles and crumbles. We are open for lunch and dinner every day and we serve a traditional roast for lunch on Sundays. We welcome children seated at a table in the bar area up to 6:30 pm and up to 7:00 pm in the restaurant. Well-behaved dogs on leads are welcome in the bar area and in the garden. Discover the Fox & Hounds Escape the daily grind of city life with a visit to The Fox and Hounds, Englefield Green. Easily accessible from London, enjoy a slice of heaven amongst the tranquil surroundings of Windsor Great Park. Book Now We source only local fresh produce We serve regional French and mediterranean cuisine as well as British classics, including a traditional roast on Sundays with all the trimmings. We have an extensive wine list with carefully chosen wines and we are extremely proud of our well-earned reputation for excellent beer. A La Carte Dinner Sample Menu A La Carte Lunch Sample Menu Lunchtime Sample Menu Sunday Lunch Sample Menu Wine list Bookings You can easily book a table online by clicking the button below. For any questions, please call us on 01784 433098 . You can also email us info@thefoxandhoundsrestaurant.com Book Now Join Us If you would like to be part of our team in the kitchen or in the pub and restaurant, we'd love to hear from you. Please get in touch by emailing us at info@ thefoxandhoundsrestaurant .com 01784 433098 info@thefoxand houndsrestaurant.com Bishopsgate Rd, Englefield Green Egham, Surrey, TW20 0XU Opening Times We are open at 11:00 daily for drinks. Monday to Thursday Lunch is served 12:00 to 3:00 pm Dinner is served 5:00 pm to 9:00 pm Friday Lunch is served 12:00 to 3:00 pm Dinner is served 5:00 to 9:30 pm Saturday Lunch is served from 12:00 to 5:00 pm Dinner is served from 5:00 pm to 9:30 pm Sunday Lunch is served from 12:00 to 5:00 pm (this is a set menu that includes a selection of traditional roasts) Dinner is served from 5:00 pm to 8:00 pm (a la carte menu) Please note that our menus are sample menus as we change them frequently. Site Map © Copyright 2025 The Fox & Hounds Web Design By Toolkit Websites

Horse & Hound - Al Habtoor Polo Resort Home Rooms Villas Dining Horse & Hound Andalucia Equestrian Lounge Oasis Pool Bar & Lounge The Clubhouse Private Dining Italian Restaurant Villa Naas La Colline Darkom Lounge Weddings & Meetings Offers Polo Elite Access Dining Offers Room Offers Spa Offers News Loyal by AHG The Dubai Sharks RFC Wellness Recreational Facilities Local Attraction Gallery Contact Us ✕ Dining Horse & Hound Horse & Hound Here at the Horse & Hound, you may enjoy the more modern trappings of gastro excellence or choose to savour your chalice of choice in a garden-inspired terrace with a stunning view of green polo fields. Dine on a variety of light bites, salads, and delicious main dishes accompanied by a fantastic selection of house beverages and cocktails. Open Daily from 12:00 pm – 02:00 am Book Now × Menu Instagram Offers Catch all the action LIVE Catch your favorite sports live on giant screens at Horse and Hound! Enjoy irresistible food and beverage deals while you cheer on your team. Don’t miss out! For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Amine Solo Join us every Friday at 7:00 pm at Horse & Hound for an evening of soulful tunes performed by Amine. Sip on refreshing drinks, enjoy delicious bites, and let the music set the perfect tone for your night out! For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . BIG Bingo Mondays by Rich Join us every Monday from 7:30pm for an evening of fun and excitement! Enjoy thrilling bingo and music bingo rounds, hosted by Rich, with plenty of chances to win the big accumulating cash prize and other guaranteed rewards! For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Midweek Unplugged with Ryan Keen Escape the hustle and unwind every Wednesday at 7:00 PM with live music and incredible vibes! Join us for a night of soulful tunes, refreshing drinks, and a relaxed atmosphere, perfect for recharging your week. For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Saturday Social at Horse & Hound Join us every Saturday from 1PM to 4PM for a laid-back yet lively brunch experience in our air-conditioned, pet-friendly summer tent. What to expect: AED 259 per person with house beverages Family-style 3-course sharing platter featuring H&H favorites Signature drinks including Aperol Spritz, Espresso Martinis, and chilled beers Live entertainment to set the perfect weekend vibe Gather your friends, bring your pups, and make Saturdays social again at Horse & Hound. For reservations and more information, please contact +971 56 545 8391 . Catch Every F1 Race LIVE Bring the whole crew and experience the thrill of Formula 1 every race weekend! Enjoy unbeatable food and drink deals throughout the race. Relax in our fully air-conditioned tent for maximum comfort. Catch all the action on massive LED screens that bring every moment to life. For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Husband Day Care Need some guilt-free me-time? Leave him with us at Horse & Hound’s pet-friendly summer tent and we will take care of the rest. Our Husband Day Care offers everything he needs to stay entertained – from live music, ice-cold beers, and tasty bites to live sports, darts, and pool. It is the perfect everyday hangout – relaxed, lively, and pet-friendly too! For reservations and more information, please contact +971 56 545 8391 . Steak Night Tuesdays just got tastier! Enjoy a juicy steak with fries and a glass of red grape for AED 139. Join us from 6:00 pm onwards for Steak Night at Horse & Hound. For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Curry Night Horse & Hound’s Wednesday Curry Night from 6 pm! Dive into rich, aromatic curries paired with basmati rice and raita bread for just AED 65 per person. For reservations and more information, please contact, +971 56 545 8391 . Contact Us info@habtoorpoloresort.com +971 4 435 4444 Wadi Al Safa 5, Emirates Road 611, Dubai, United Arab Emirates Sustainability Stay Connected © 2025 Al Habtoor Polo Resort, LLC. All rights reserved.

Horse & Hound Contact us at Horse & Hound SUBSCRIPTION ENQUIRIES If you are an existing magazine or digital subscriber who is having delivery problems, would like to change your delivery address, are having issues accessing your digital services, or if you have any other queries about your subscription, please login to your account at www.mymagazine.co.uk or email help@mymagazine.co.uk If you’d like to take out a new subscription please visit www.magazinesdirect.com or email help@magazinesdirect.com ADVERTISING ENQUIRIES For information about advertising across Horse & Hound’s media platforms, contact: Justeen Jones Commercial Partnerships Director justeen.jones@futurenet.com tel: +44 (0)330 390 6163 CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING If you have any questions about classified advertising, please call 0330 390 3774 or email: rebecca.norris@futurenet.com HORSES FOR SALE If you have any questions about horses for sale, or are experiencing problems when trying to place your advert online, please call 07995 35683 or email: tackroom@whickr.com H&H EDITORIAL ENQUIRIES If you have an enquiry about Horse&Hound magazine or website please find the most relevant member of the editorial team here If you wish to make an editorial complaint or submit a report that you believe Horse & Hound has not complied with the Independent Press Standards Organisation’s Editors’ Code of Practice , please contact legal@futurenet.com . HOW TO SUBMIT AN OBITUARY TO H&H To submit an obituary for potential publication in H&H, please email hhobituaries@futurenet.com with 300-350 words, along with a high resolution image. The image does not have to be recent, but it must have the photographer’s permission for the image to be republished in this context. If it is a professional photo, written permission for use must be included. If you would prefer for the H&H team to prepare the obituary, please provide details of the person’s involvement in the equestrian industry, along with a contact telephone number of a friend or family member of the deceased. H&H FORUM ENQUIRIES If you have an enquiry about the Horse&Hound website forum, please complete the online form that can be found by clicking on the ‘contact us’ link in the footer on any forum page. Go to the H&H forum >> TECHNICAL ENQUIRIES/PROBLEMS If you experience any technical problems with this website, please contact us specifying which device you are using (PC or Mac laptop, android or apple mobile or tablet) and which browser, including version number, you are using (e.g. Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, Opera, etc). Any technical questions should be sent to: Carol Phillips Website editor carol.phillips@futurenet.com SYNDICATION Future’s syndication services can give you access to a wide selection of the finest articles and pictures from the world’s oldest equestrian magazine. We can license content to be used in print, online, broadcasting, marketing and advertising. Find out more at futurecontenthub.com or email ukcontent@futurenet.com COMMERCIAL ENQUIRIES If you would like to discuss sponsorships, content licensing or commercial partnerships, please contact: Dave Clutterbuck Managing Director dave.clutterbuck@futurenet.com HORSE & HOUND NEWS DESK If you have a news story for H&H please contact the news desk. Eleanor Jones News editor, Horse&Hound eleanor.jones@futurenet.com tel: +44 (0)330 390 6386 HORSE & HOUND LETTERS If you would like to send a submission to be considered for publication on the H&H letters page in the magazine, please email hhletters@futurenet.com including your name, nearest town and county. We reserve the right to edit letters for length and readability. INSERTS Marian Jonjo – Canopy Media Marian.Jonjo@canopymedia.co.uk tel: +44 (0)53 939 9245 If you live outside of the UK, and would like to purchase a copy of the magazine, please see below for full details of our international distribution agents. (Dubai) Horse & Hound Levant Internat- ional S.A.L. Tel: 00-33 15 37 01 077 Editorial staff To call members of the Horse & Hound editorial team, please find the correct telephone numbers below. To email a member of staff please use the following format – firstname.surname@futurenet.com Editor-in-Chief: Sarah Jenkins Magazine Editor/Eventing: Pippa Roome (07815 442555) Website Editor: Carol Phillips (0330 390 6598) News Editor: Eleanor Jones (0330 390 6386) Senior News Writer: Lucy Elder (0330 390 3947) Senior News Writer/Pony Club: Becky Murray (0330 390 6484) Showjumping/Racing: Jennifer Donald Dressage/Sport Horse Breeding/Products Assistant: Oscar Williams (07468 431526) Showing: Bethan Simons Hunting: Catherine Austen (0330 390 7354) Features Editor/Polo/Riding Clubs: Martha Terry (0330 390 6327) Web Features/Point-to-Point/Digital Racing: Gemma Redrup (0330 390 6480) Head of Ecommerce: Georgia Guerin Products: Franchesca Slack Features Assistant: Bethany Stone Chief Sub Editor (Print): Rebecca Philpot Print Sub Editor (Print)/Vet: Briony Reed Print Sub Editor (Print): Jane Gazzard Group Art Editor: Emily Secrett Deputy Art Editor: Sophie Cheeseman Picture Editor: Rebecca Pattenden (07718 277227) Group Sports Picture Editor: Richard Tole (07753 326285) Publishing Managing Director: Dave Clutterbuck Advertising Advertising Director: Rebecca Norris (+44 (0)7929 369204) Commercial Partnerships Director: Justeen Jones (0330 390 6163) Classified Advertisers: 0330 390 3774 Production Manager: Chris Gozzett (0330 390 4154) SUBSCRIPTIONS tel: 0330 333 1113 How to order a back issue of Horse & Hound If you would like to purchase a paper issue of Horse & Hound which is no longer on sale but was published in the past nine weeks, please click here to order or call +44(0)330 333 1113. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Show More Carol Phillips H&H website editor Carol is an experienced journalist and editor, who is also a passionate amateur rider and dedicated horse owner, having ridden since childhood. She has a particular interest in the emotional well-being and ethical training of horses, alongside veterinary matters, having garnered extensive first-hand experience of numerous equine health conditions through more than 30 years of horse ownership. The Horse & Hound Delgany Home Menus The Rooms Special Events Plan Your Visit H&H Gifts and Gear Gallery Book Your Stay Buy A Gift Card Check Your Gift Card Balance Home Menus The Rooms Special Events Plan Your Visit H&H Gifts and Gear Gallery Reservations 01 287 4642 Book Your Stay Buy A Gift Card Check Your Gift Card Balance Scroll delgany / co wicklow The Horse and Hound Delgany pub / award winning restaurant / rooms / beer garden/ private events YOUR LOCAL BEST EATERY 4X RUNNING FROM OUR FABULOUS TEAM! AND FEATURING OUR NEW FAB MENU!  BOOK ONLINE OR CALL 01 287 4642 - CAN’T WAIT TO WELCOME YOU! Every Sunday features our roast and selections from our brand new expanded MENU debuting from our Executive Chef Claire Moes! Yes, more decor has filled into our fabulous new SPORTS BAR and featuring new brews on our snappy new Beer Lines! We have your favorite line ups of year round favorites - and some new ones on offer — as well as 0.0 options for those looking to keep things under control during close matches. Celebrating anything with your friends, family or your team?  Come on down to the HORSE! Remember we are open every Friday and Saturdays at 12 Noon; and Sundays open at 12:30 with our Restaurant open for lunch as well!  We will be happy to entertain private parties and group bookings.  We now offer online restaurant bookings through Res Diary, so request your table in our lovely restaurant today! CLICK HERE to read about our new menu! Please note you need to call to book for special events like the Lions Breakfast and the Sunday Set List, otherwise book online! BOOK TABLE NOW LUNCH NOW 7 DAYS FROM NOON! Pub Toastie, Korean Chix or Charcuterie?  Not your normal pub grub! SPECIAL PACKAGES AVAILABLE for your SPECIAL DAY CLICK HERE THANKS FOR MAKING OUR HERITAGE DAY FESTIVAL A HUGE SUCCESS!!! THIS SEASON GiVE A HORSE AND HOUND CUSTOM DIGITAL GIFT CARD FOR ANY OCCASSION!  EDELIVERY!  CLICK HERE! BOOK YOUR ROOMS! What is nicer than hanging out at the Horse?  Staying HERE! Invite Friends, Family and Guests to join our community and stay with us for a night or two when visiting the area.  Our rooms are cozy and the atmosphere is second to none! CHECK AVAILABILITY AND BOOK YOUR ROOM NOW! DINE STAY CELEBRATE your local character Since 1790 the Horse and Hound has been front and center in the heart of Delgany Heritage Village and has always been close to the community.  Whether coming in for a pint, bite, fine dining, special occasion or a stay in our cozy rooms, we invite you to experience our authentic character and enjoy every little detail.  We love our corner of the world and proudly feature Local craft brews, distilleries, and ingredients.  You are always very welcome. PLAN YOUR VISIT TO DELGANY Convent Road, Delgany, Co Wicklow A63DY20 Instagram / Facebook We can't wait to see you. Get in Touch | The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant Tap to call Home Menus Specials Events Accommodation Camping Private Dining Contact Us Thank You Privacy Policy BOOK NOW The Hare & Hounds Eat. Drink. Stay. Enjoy! Contact Us Please contact us with any questions or comments using the information below. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you! Address The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, Crayes Green, Layer Breton, Colchester, Essex, CO2 0PN Get in Touch 01206 330459 info@thehareandhound.co.uk Spam protection By filling out this form and accepting below, you are giving explicit consent to us contacting you. By doing this you are acknowledging our privacy policy. It is your right at any time to unsubscribe and stop receiving further communications.* Privacy Policy This Privacy Policy applies to The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant. (along with all subsidiaries, affiliates, successors and assigns thereof, referred to hereinafter collectively as “The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant”, "we", "our" and/or "us"), our websites and services. The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant knows that you care how information about you is used and shared, and we appreciate your expectation that we will do so carefully and sensibly. By visiting this or another The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant website displaying this Privacy Policy or a link thereto (a "Website", or collectively the “Websites”), or by otherwise interacting with The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant you agree to accept the practices described in this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy is further subject to the The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant Services Agreement related to the The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant services you utilise and/or purchase. For questions on this Privacy Policy please contact our team via the contact information found on this Website. The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant values your privacy and is dedicated to protecting your personal information and providing you with notice about what personally identifiable information we collect and how it is used, what choices you have regarding the collection, use and distribution of that information, the security procedures we implement to protect that information and what access you may have to correct any inaccuracies in the information we have collected from you. What Information Is Collected We receive and store any information you enter on our Websites or give us in any other way, such as via telephone, electronic mail, online or otherwise. For example, this information may be collected when you contact us for customer support. Here are the types of information we gather: Contact Information: We collect and retain personal contact information that you submit to us voluntarily and this includes, but is not limited to, your name, mailing address, web address, telephone number, and e-mail address. This information may include your full name, mailing address, phone number, email address, and, where provided, your fax number. Such contact information may be used, for example, to communicate with you when necessary with respect to transactions. Additionally, we may collect contact information provided to us during any correspondence relating to customer support, as well as in connection with products and services offered on our Websites. Financial Information: We collect and retain certain financial information from when you purchase our products and services. For example, when you sign up for any other product or service through The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, we require you to provide a credit card number and billing address before we will process that application. We will not sell, share or rent any financial information collected from you except as disclosed in this Privacy Policy or as necessary to fulfil any order for our products or services. Demographic Information: We may collect and store anonymous demographic information (such as your postcode, gender and age), and use this data to tailor your experience on our Websites, provide content that we think you might be interested in, perform general improvements to the Websites, and display the content according to your preferences. Such demographic information may be shared with partners, market researchers and other third parties on an aggregate, non-personally identifiable basis. No personally identifiable information will be linked to such aggregated demographic information that is shared with third parties. Other Information: We collect and store certain types of information whenever you interact with us. For example, our servers track the type of web browser you are using and the page from which you link. Additionally, we log IP addresses (a unique number assigned to every computer on the Internet) in order to improve security, analyse trends and administer the Websites. We may track your movement within the Websites, the third-party website pages from which you were referred, access times and browser types. We use this information to gauge the effectiveness of our Websites, track information for statistical purposes and to improve the products and services we provide. We collect this information to better develop a sense of what services our customers need and identify areas of improvement to the Websites. We may use such information for marketing purposes, and to send information to you that we believe might be of interest. In addition, such information may be shared with partners, market researchers and other third parties on an aggregate, non-personally identifiable basis. No personally identifiable information will be linked to such aggregated information shared with third parties. We may supplement the information you provide us by acquiring publicly or commercially available information as available in the public domain or from third parties, for instance, to verify your address or to update your information and to create a profile of your preferences. We tie your personally identifiable information to information in the profile, in order to improve the content of the Websites for you or to inform you about products or services that we think will be of interest to you. From time to time, we may also ask you to participate in surveys or other communications conducted by us or third parties designed to help us improve the Websites or the products or services we provide. Cookies: The Websites use “cookies” such purposes as enhancing your online experience by making it easier for you to navigate through the Websites and making certain features work better. Cookies are text files which are commonly deposited by websites on a user's hard drive when the user visits a website. The file identifies a user's computer and can record the user's preferences and other data about the user's website visit. We do not extract information about individual users during this process. Your web browser may enable you to disable cookies, but please note that certain services may not function correctly without it and your experience on our Websites may be hindered. Third Party Cookies: We may use third-party advertising companies to serve ads on our behalf across the Internet. These companies may collect and use information about your visits to this and other websites and your interaction with our products and services in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you. However, no personally identifiable information (such as your name, address, email address or telephone number) will be connected with such information. They may use information about your visits to this and other websites to target advertisements for goods and services and may be used to keep track of user response to each advertisement. These targeted advertisements may appear on our Websites or on other sites that you visit. The anonymous information is collected through the use of a pixel tag or cookies, which are industry standard technologies used by most major websites. If you do not want such companies to collect this information you may opt-out. To learn more about the use of this information or choose not to have this information used by certain third-party advertising partners, please visit the Network Advertising Initiative at http://www.networkadvertising.org/choices. Please note that if you delete your cookies, use a different browser, or buy a new computer, you will need to renew your opt-out choice. Web Beacons: The Websites may contain electronic images (called a "single-pixel GIF" or a "web beacon") that allow a website to track the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. No personally identifiable information will be transmitted via web beacons. Telephone Recording and Monitoring: To ensure The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant customers receive quality service, The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant selects phone calls for recording and/or monitoring. These calls, between The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant customers (or potential customers) and employees, are evaluated by The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant representatives. This is to guarantee that prompt, consistent assistance and accurate information is delivered in a professional manner. In contacting The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant creating an account with The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, or by otherwise utilising any The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant products or services, you hereby consent to any such call recording and/or monitoring. How Personal Information Is Used Our Use: We receive and store any personal information you enter on our Websites or give to us voluntarily in any other way and may use it to contact you from time to time. We take steps designed to ensure that only the employees who need access to your personal information to fulfil their employment duties will have access to it. By registering on a Website and providing your telephone number, you agree that this action constitutes a purchase, enquiry and/or application for purposes of telemarketing laws. Regardless of the fact that your telephone and/or cell number may be listed with the TPS, you are providing your express written consent to receive future information (including telemarketing) about products and services from us and/or our affiliates, and you hereby agree and consent to our contacting you using the information you have provided and will provide to us. This means we may contact you by e-mail, phone and/or cell number (including use of automated dialling equipment and/or pre-recorded calls), text (SMS) message, social networks or any other means of communication that your wireless or other telecommunications device may be capable of receiving (i.e. video, etc.). We may also send you information or offers from time to time to the postal address or email address we have on file (as further outlined in this Privacy Policy). You further acknowledge that you are not required to agree directly or indirectly or enter into an agreement regarding our telemarketing efforts as a condition of purchasing any goods or services from us or our affiliates. Electronic Mail: From time to time, The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant may use your personal information to contact you by electronic mail concerning our services. These communications are often intended to inform you of important information regarding your account, or about general services provided by The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant and/or its affiliates. If you do not want to receive email from us or our affiliates regarding new services, please click the "unsubscribe" link which is included at the bottom of any email you receive from us. However, in order to fulfil our service obligations to you, we will continue to send you emails regarding your account administration, as well as any necessary information, such as renewal notices and instructions. By providing us with your email address you consent to receiving communications from us electronically and all notices, disclosures and other communications that we provide to you electronically satisfy any legal requirement that such communications be in writing. Service Related Uses: We may use your personal information to contact you about the goods or services you have purchased from us, or for other purposes in which you have expressed an interest, for example, if you have contacted customer service or made an enquiry. We will also provide you with service and account related announcements. For instance, if the delivery of a service or product is delayed we might send you an email, or other message, or if there is some service issue with something you might have ordered. Generally, you may not opt-out of these communications, which are not promotional in nature. If you do not wish to receive them, you have the option to cancel your services with us. Protection of The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant and Others: We may release account and other personal information when we are required to do so by law, court order, subpoena or other government or law enforcement authority or regulatory agency, including ICANN, in order to enforce or apply our Services Agreement or other agreements, or when we believe in good faith that disclosing this information is necessary or advisable, including for example, to protect the rights, property, or safety of The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, our users, or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organisations for fraud protection, credit risk reduction or other similar purposes. Sites Other Than The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant has no control over and is not responsible for the privacy policies or information gathering practices of other websites, including those to which we may link and those which may link to us. We strongly recommend that you review the privacy policies of every online service you use before submitting any personal information and direct any concerns to the site administrator of that website. How Long We Keep Your Personal Data We keep information only for as long as we need it to provide you services, manage our business or as required by law or contract. Where you have a contract with us, we will retain your data for the length of the contract, and will further retain that information for a time period consistent with our legal or regulatory responsibilities, after you terminate all your services with us to resolve disputes, enforce our relevant Service Agreement, and to adhere to the technical and legal requirements and constraints related to the security, integrity and operation of the Sites. If you have any questions about how long we will keep your specific data, please contact us. How We Keep Your Personal Data Safe We work to protect the security of your financial information during transmission by using Secure Sockets Layer ("SSL") software, which encrypts the information you input on the Site. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is completely secure and we cannot guarantee its absolute security. You can further help to ensure your security by taking a few simple precautions. For instance, it is important to protect against unauthorised access to your computer, and to be sure to sign off when you are finished using a shared computer. Limitation Of Liability The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant assumes no responsibility or liability with regard to any theft, loss, alteration or misuse of personal or other information lawfully provided by The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant to third parties, or with regard to the failure of any third party to abide by this privacy policy or such third party. Contacting Us If you have questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy, you can contact us by writing to us at info@thehareandhound.co.uk or by mail at The Hare And Hounds Pub & Restaurant, Crayes Green, Layer Breton, Colchester, Essex, CO2 0PN. hCaptcha This site is protected by hCaptcha and its Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. A second Horse & Hounds News Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals NEWS A second Horse & Hounds EXTRA HELPINGS with RICK ALLEN If we on the east side are really good and eat all our veggies, Santa may have an early surprise for us this holiday season: a brand-new Horse & Hounds Restaurant and Pub on our side of town! Actually the right jolly old elf has nothing to do with it, except as a way to get into this. But Wendell Landry certainly does. The owner of the existing Horse & Hounds out U.S. 27 near the Golden Ocala development is determined to build a new eatery across town. And later maybe others farther afield, say in Orlando and Tampa. "Our target is to open by November . . . over in Silver Springs," Landry says. "It's very ambitious, but that's our target." Still, he declines to pinpoint an exact location because not all the papers have been finalized; he expects they will be in a fortnight. A number of advantages from a second Horse & Hounds immediately spring to mind. First, finally a long-recognized top-notch restaurant is planting roots east of 36th Avenue, and where one goes others tend to follow. Rumors are rampant right now about new restaurants looking at the Silver Springs area, but no one has been willing to publicly commit. Only Chili's says a new unit is coming to Ocala, but the chain hasn't yet said where. Another advantage for we dinners is the existing Horse & Hounds long ago was adopted by the equine industry out in the northwest corner of Marion County. And when HITS is in town, like right now, a reservation is generally the only ticket in on many nights, particularly on weekends. While the meals are worth every mile, who wants to drive nearly 20 miles one way if you can't get in? If you can't get to it, what does it matter how good the food is! Another Horse & Hounds in town can help ease that pressure. From the restaurant's point of view, a brand-new facility means a brand-new kitchen — one that's all in one place, and not like the split kitchen in what'll probably become the original house. Plus it'll be his house. Landry acquired the Horse & Hounds from the original owners, the Roses, a couple of years back. To run it, he brought in Austrian restaurateur Johannes Slacik, a 2004 recipient of the prestigious Chaine des Rotisseurs culinary fellowship that dates back to 1248. Slacik returned to Austria several months ago, though his honors still decorate a Horse & Hounds wall. Landry says after Slacik left, he wondered if he wanted to continue the restaurant. A fortunate series of events convinced him to go forward, and to even think bigger about expansion. His daughter, Kerrie Landry-Sanchez, is general manager. The new unit is likely to feel more like an English pub, in the traditional European sense, even more than the cozy gentlemen's hunt club ambiance of the current house. "I don't want to be a bar, but more of a public house that's family oriented," Landry says. He's planning a trip to England in a few months to secure some actual pub pieces for the decor. The menu is likely to include several selections of healthier fare and smaller portions than are preferred by the hard-driving equine ranchers on the northwest side. "We're excited," Landry adds. "I don't think we'll be an Outback, but there's a niche for a Horse & Hounds." BURN MOR PE'NUT O'L: Maybe you've noticed the Chick-fil-A car tooling about Ocala's roads. Well, it's not the peanut oil-burning vehicle unveiled to chain franchise owners recently in Orlando. "It's mine," admits Jess Burton, marketing director for the Chick-fil-A on College Road. And it runs on regular gas. Meanwhile, the truck debuted in Orlando just might be the chain's new long-term project. And while it might be addicted to oil, it's not the kind from the Middle East, or even the Alaskan wilderness. Instead, it's the oil the chain uses to cook chicken and waffle fries, from peanuts — like the tasty tubers grown on some 8,000 acres right here in Marion County, says Extension Agent David Holmes, though he adds their higher value is in roasting or boiling like they are right now. Still, Burton says, "we use a lot of the oil in our store." The oil is changed out in the store about every third day. However, it's trucked away for disposal. According to a report in the Atlanta Business Chronicle, the chain is looking into the cooking oil-burning technology for cars. Evidently, something called a "Greasecar" fuel conversion system works with diesel engines. According to the Chronicle report, the chain usually gives away the oil for free; it can amount to nearly 4 million gallons of oil per year. For now, a Chick-fil-A spokesman is quoted as saying, "the company is simply examining the technology and 'offering information on alternative fuel sources' to any interested franchisees." The report further quotes Michael Garjian, a principal in Greasecar Vegetable Fuel Systems, as saying the 2,500-mile round-trip from Massassachusetts to Florida burns 220 gallons of peanut oil and only 8 gallons of diesel, "saving $600 in fuel costs and preventing 4,900 pounds of global-warming gases from entering the atmosphere." And I would bet it probably smells a lot better than diesel emissions, too! __________ Rick Allen can be reached at rick.allen@starbanner.com or 867-4122.
